result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:55 PM Defendant Demetrius Lloyd in court.  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Demetrius Lloyd.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Beth Raymond in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests warrant vacated. State made arguments addressing DCPS violation reports. Warrant vacated, defendant to report to DCPS. Previous bail conditions to continue. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defn eligible for SPD but no appointment has been made as of yet; case nearing 90 days with no counsel so it will be set to trial branch to see if appointment of counsel from the bench should occur; Court clarified that defn in fact did waive time limits; bail continued

Judge made oral ruling to quash warrant. Email sent.

12:04AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson Defendant Demetrius Lloyd not in court. Attorney Demetrius Lloyd. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes hearings were set for 8:30am and defendant does not appear. State gives update that the defendant was given notice in hand at the last hearing. State request body only warrant. Court will grant and so order. Back on the record at 3:57pm. Defendant in court without counsel. State appears intern Jackie Frank supervised by Atty Frank Remington . States gives update, the defendant appeared at the courthouse this afternoon and meet with pretrial services, who contacted the Court and explained reason. State gives position statement and impacts to the victim rights impacts. State does not object to warrants being quashed.  Court addresses bond, cash bond will remain in place. Court referral to pretrial services for GPS done. . Court questions defendant on status of obtaining counsel and the defendant responds. Court makes findings and will not issue a warrant in 22CF1262 and will quash the warrants in 22CF1549 and 22CF1700. Defendant waives time limits in all 3 cases. Court sets for status conference.  All the conditions remain in place and Court instructs the defendant to return to pretrial services asap.

12:04AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson Defendant Demetrius Lloyd not in court. Attorney Demetrius Lloyd. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes hearings were set for 8:30am and defendant does not appear. State gives update that the defendant was given notice in hand at the last hearing. State request body only warrant. Court will grant and so order

Per Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS) violation report, Court orders bench warrant issued. 
If the Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCPS. If the Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCPS is required to enforce conditions of release and the Defendant shall report to DCPS by 10:00 a.m. on the business day following release from jail. All other bail conditions remain set.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: increase bail by $250, bench warrant to be issued. Bail hearing previously scheduled can be cancelled

Appointment of Counsel Report- OSPD
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kanye J. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

02:40 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
